Annas we knowe he hath wrowth gret fole A-geyns Ã¾e lawe shewyd present Ther-fore pylat sent hym on to Ã¾e Ã¾at Ã¾ou xuldyst gyf hym jugement. Herowde Rex Now be Mahound my god of grace of pylat Ã¾is is A dede ful kende I for-gyf hym now his gret trespace And schal be his frend with-owtyn ende. Jhesus to me Ã¾at he wole sende I desyred ful sore hym for to se gret ese in Ã¾is pylat xal fynde and jhesus Ã¾ou art welcome to me. ius judeus My sovereyn lord Ã¾is is Ã¾e case Ã¾e gret falsnesse of jhesu is opynly knawe Ã¾er was nevyr man dede so gret trespas ffor he hath Al-most dystroyd oure lawe. ijus judeus ?a be fals crafte of soserye wrowth opynly to Ã¾e pepyll Alle and be sotyl poyntys of nygramancye many thowsandys fro oure lawe be falle. Cayphas Most excellent kyng ?e must take hede he wol dystroye all Ã¾is countre both elde and ?yng yf he ten monthis more procede be his meraclys and fals prechyng he bryngyth Ã¾e pepyl in gret fonnyng And seyth dayly A-mong hem Alle That he is lord and of Ã¾e jewys kyng and Ã¾e sone of god he doth hym calle. Rex Herowde Serys Alle Ã¾ese materys I haue herd sayd and meche more Ã¾an ?e me telle Alle to-gedyr Ã¾ei xal be layde And I wyl take Ã¾er on cowncelle. Jhesus Ã¾ou Art wel-come to me I kan pylat gret thank for his sendying I haue desyryd ful longe Ã¾e to se and of Ã¾i meracles to haue knowyng. It is told me Ã¾ou dost many A wondyr thyng Crokyd to gon and blynd men to sen and Ã¾ei Ã¾at ben dede gevyst hem levyng And makyst lepers fayre and hool to ben. These Arn wondyr werkys wrought of Ã¾e be what wey I wolde knowe Ã¾e trew sentens Now jhesu I pray the lete me se O meracle wrougth in my presens. In hast now do Ã¾i dylygens And per-Aventure I wyl shew favour to the for now Ã¾ou art in my presens thyn lyf and deth here lyth in me. And here jhesus xal not speke no word to Ã¾e herowde. Jhesus why spekyst not to Ã¾i kyng what is Ã¾e cawse Ã¾ou stondyst so stylle Ã¾ou knowyst I may deme All thyng thyn lyf and deth lyth At my wylle. What spek jhesus and telle me why Ã¾is pepyl do Ã¾e so here Acuse spare not but telle me now on hey how Ã¾ou canst Ã¾i-self excuse. Cayphas loo serys Ã¾is is of hym A false sotylte he wyl not speke but whan he lyst Ã¾us he dysceyvyth Ã¾e pepyl in eche degre he is ful fals ?e veryly tryst. Rex herowde What Ã¾ou on-hangyd harlot why wylt Ã¾ou not speke hast Ã¾ou skorne to speke on to Ã¾i kyng be-cawse Ã¾ou dost oure lawys breke I trowe Ã¾ou art A-ferd of oure talkyng. Annas Nay he is not Aferde but of A fals wyle be-cawse we xuld not hym A-cuse if Ã¾at he Answerd ?ow on-tylle he knowyth he can not hym-self excuse. Rex herowde what spek I say Ã¾ou foulyng evyl mote Ã¾ou fare loke up Ã¾e devyl mote Ã¾e cheke Serys bete his body with scorgys bare And A-say to make hym for to speke. ius judeus it xal be do with-outyn teryeng come on Ã¾ou tretour evyl mot Ã¾ou Ã¾e whylt Ã¾ou not speke on-to oure kyng A new lesson we xal lere Ã¾e. here Ã¾ei pulle of jhesus clothis and betyn hym with whyppys. ijus judeus Jhesus Ã¾i bonys we xal not breke but we xal make Ã¾e to skyppe Ã¾ou hast lost Ã¾i tonge Ã¾ou mayst not speke Ã¾ou xalt a-say now of Ã¾is whippe. iijus judeus Serys take Ã¾ese whyppys in ?our hande and spare not whyl Ã¾ei last and bete Ã¾is tretoure Ã¾at here doth stonde I trowe Ã¾at he wyl speke in hast and qwan Ã¾ei han betyn hym tyl he is alle blody Ã¾an Ã¾e herownde seyth Sees serys I comawnde ?ou be name of Ã¾e devyl of helle Jhesus thynkyst Ã¾is good game Ã¾ou Art strong to suffyr schame Ã¾ou haddyst levyr be betyn lame Ã¾an Ã¾i defawtys for to telle. But I wyl not Ã¾i body All spyl nor put it here in-to more peyn Serys takyth jhesus At ?our owyn wyl and lede hym to pylat hom Ageyn Grete hym weyl and telle hym serteyn All my good frenchep xal he haue I gyf hym powere of jhesus Ã¾us ?e hym seyn Whether he wole hym dampne or save. ius doctor Sere at ?our request it xal be do we xal lede jhesus at ?our demawde and delyver hym Pylat on-to And telle hym all as ?e comawnde.
